fullText: This sterling revival of August Wilson's 'Jitney' makes a persuasive case that the play, which opened Thursday night at the Samuel J. Friedman Theater, deserves to be regarded as highly as any in the author's celebrated Pittsburgh Cycle.

bwwExcerpt: Conversation sings and swings, bends and bounces and hits heaven smack in the clouds, in the glorious new production of August Wilson's 'Jitney,' which opened on Thursday night at the Samuel J. Friedman Theater. In Ruben Santiago-Hudson's vital revival of a 1982 play only now making its Broadway debut, words take on the shimmer of molten-gold notes from the trumpets of Louis and Miles.
